title: How large would the star Trappist-1 appear from one of the newly discovered exoplanets orbiting it? - Quora
tags: Discovery of 7 Earth-Like Planets Orbiting TRAPPIST-1 (February 2017)

response.answer_text: TRAPPIST-1 has an estimated radius of about 0.11 times that of the Sun, giving it a diameter of about 153,000 kilometers. The planets all orbit at different distances, naturally; the nearest is about 1.66 million kilometers out, while the farthest is about 9.42 million kilometers. The formula for angular diameter, the size an object appears in the sky, is [math]2\arctan \left(\frac{d}{2D}\right)[/math], where [math]d[/math] is the diameter of the object and [math]D[/math] is the distance. This yields values of 5.28 and 0.93 degrees for the closest and farthest planets, respectively. The full moon subtends an angle of a little less than half a degree in the sky.
